Each Botany Kit includes and requires the common following equipment pieces to be used:

  • Hand Shovel (@Compendium[undertaking.weapons.4XDEFIHFNG2WNIOR]{Dagger}, without the Thrown trait)
  • Hand Rake (@Compendium[undertaking.weapons.4XDEFIHFNG2WNIOR]{Dagger}, without the Thrown trait)
  • Hand Hoe (@Compendium[undertaking.weapons.4SHZ7Y8QLKRH1I4J]{Sickle})
  • Pruning Saw (@Compendium[undertaking.weapons.4SHZ7Y8QLKRH1I4J]{Sickle})

With Botany Proficiency, you can do the following:

  • Seed Extraction: As an action, you can use up an herb, fruit, or vegetable, to harvest enough seeds from it for a 5 ft area of prepared soil.
  • Find Herbs: As a Rest Action, you can attempt to find herbs in a biome. Roll an Intelligence (Nature) check. Based on the result and environment, you find different results. If you get a high roll, you can choose to find a more common herb instead.
    Certain biomes are harder to find herbs in. Those biomes have DC modifiers listed next to their names on the @Compendium[undertaking.tables.5R8FKYXDXRVWMOQD]{Ingredients - Herbs} table.

If you have Botany Proficiency, you can use the Botany Kit in the following ways: 

  • Apply Medicinal: Over 1 minute, you can attempt to prepare and apply or use a salve, powder, poultice, vapor, oil, or other medicinal to give beneficial effects to a willing creature. These are made out of herbs, and have the same effects as those listed in the @Compendium[undertaking.tables.5R8FKYXDXRVWMOQD]{Ingredients - Herbs} table listed underneath the Alchemy Trade. Effects with a duration last 10 minutes, and effects have a potency die of 2d4 + your Wisdom (Medicine) modifier.
    When you apply a medicinal, roll a Wisdom (Medicine) check. If it doesn’t meet or exceed the herb’s DC, then the medicinal fails, and the herb is lost.
  • Tillage: Over an hour, you can till and prepare a 10 ft area of soil for planting.
  • Agriculture: As a Rest Action, you can plant seeds in a 5 ft area of prepared soil. So long as it isn’t dying, the plant grows over the course of months, but their output is greatly multiplied.
    In their natural biome, plants survive so long as they are treated once a week. Outside of their natural biome, they generally survive so long as they are treated once a day, so long as they are shielded from the more extreme elements of the biome, such as heat or cold.
    • Common Flora: 
      • Yield: x20 per 5ft.
      • Harvest Period: 1 month.
    • Uncommon Flora: 
      • Yield: x10 per 5ft.
      • Harvest Period: 2 months.
    • Rare Flora: 
      • Yield x5 per 5ft.
      • Harvest Period: 3 months.
  • Treat Plant: As a Rest Action, you can treat up to a 10 ft area worth of plants, watering and trimming them, and keeping their soil clean and pest-free. This process uses up a pint of water per 5 ft area.
    If used on a plant creature, it restores 1d6 additional hit points as part of the rest, but uses up 4 pints of water.
  • Revive Plant: A plant that has not been treated enough begins dying, and cannot be revived by normal treatment. As an action, you can use up 4 pints of water to attempt to revive the plant by making a Intelligence (Nature) check of DC 15. On success, the plant is revitalized once more.
    This can also be used to revive unconscious plant creatures with 0 hit points, or a plant creature that died within the last 1 minute (+5 to the DC in this scenario). Upon success, the plant is revitalized and restores hit points equal to your Intelligence (Nature) modifier.
